sentences: Laps sõi kiiresti ja jooksis siis mängima.
context: The word 'sõi' is the third-person singular past indicative form of the Estonian verb 'sööma', which means 'to eat'. In English, it translates to 'ate'. It's used when referring to someone eating in the past tense. For example, 'Ta sõi õuna' means 'He/she ate an apple'. The word belongs to the regular conjugation pattern of 'sööma' where the present stem 'söö-' plus '-i' forms the third-person singular past tense.
